snippet: A deadly bird flu virus that was made transmissible in mammals, touching off public fears of a pandemic, is not as contagious as people had been led to believe.
abstract: Ron Fouchier, the scientist who made a deadly bird flu virus transmissible in mammals, touching off public fears of a pandemic, says that the virus he created is neither as contagious nor as dangerous as people have been led to believe; United States asks advisory panel to re-evaluate recommendation that certain details of the work be classified, for fear that terrorists could use viruses to make bioweapons.
lead_paragraph: A deadly bird flu virus that was made transmissible in mammals, touching off public fears of a pandemic, is not as contagious as people had been led to believe.

headline.seo: Maker Says Bird Flu Virus Not as Dangerous as Thought
headline.main: Genetically Altered Bird Flu Virus Not as Dangerous as Believed, Its Maker Asserts
headline.print_headline: Genetically Altered Bird Flu Virus Not as Dangerous as Believed, Its Maker Asserts
